champ.champInfo:
General management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out created by the organizational committee of the NGO "Federation of Kuodokyokushin Karate of Ukraine". The direct responsibility for the competition rests with NGO "Federation of Kuodokyokushin Karate of Ukraine" in the city of Poltava and the panel of judges, appointed and approved by the organizing committee of the competition


Organizing committee and judges:

  • The main judge of the competition is the head of the NGO "FKKU", sports judge sensei Dmytro Boklashchuk, 4 dan (Poltava). Phone: (067) 531-80-51
  • Coordinator of the competition on organizational issues — Roman Barabash, 2 dan (Poltava)
  • Technical secretary of the competition - Oleksandr Ivanov, 2nd dan (Poltava)
  • Technical support — Igor Tatarchenko (Lviv)

Venue of the competition: M. POLTAVA, STREET. KOMAROVA 2 A, SPORTS COMPLEX "Poltava Medical Glass Plant"

The competition will be held in Poltava on April 7, 2024.

Competition program

April 6 (Saturday):

  • 17:00 - 19:00 mandate committee, weighing of athletes

April 7 (Sunday):

  • 09:00 -10:40 Start of competition in the "Kata" section, semi-final and final matches
  • 10:40 - 11:00 Awarding of prize winners and finalists in the "Kata" section
  • 11:00-11:15 Official opening of the competition in the "Kumite" section
  • 17:00 – 17:30 closing of the competition, awarding of winners and prize-winners in the "Kumite" section

Competition rules.

  • If, based on previous applications, there is an insufficient number of participants for high-quality holding of competitions in certain categories, the Organizing Committee may make the following changes to the Regulations for these competitions:
    • merge bordering weight categories
    • hold competitions in specified weight categories in a round-robin fashion
  • Competitions are held separately for male and female participants

Competition participants.

  • All participants must submit the following documents to the mandate committee
    • birth certificate;
    • if there is no photo card in the record book - a student card with a photo card
    • parents' permission to participate in the competition, which is entered in the record book (budo-passport of the NGO "FKKU" or the represented organization)
    • written permission of parents to participate in competitions for invited teams of other federations
    • voluntary health insurance policy
  • Participants compete in appropriate uniforms and personal protective protectors in accordance with the Rules of Kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine
  • soft hand protectors - according to the principle of "stockings"
  • grade belt
  • White shin and groin protectors, girls' chest protector (to be worn under a white T-shirt) are personal and mandatory
  • Helmets will not be provided by competition organizers

Kata categories:

Age Gender First circle Second Round/Final
U9 Boys/Girls Taikioku sono ichi Taikioku sono san, Pinan sono Ichi
U11 Boys/Girls Pinan sono Ichi Pinan sono no, Pinan sono san, Pinan sono GO
U13 Boys/Girls Pinan sono Ichi Pinan sono no, Pinan sono san, Pinan sono GO
U15 Boys/Girls Pinan sono no Pinan sono go, Yantsu, Tsukino kata, Gekisai dai, Gekisai sho
U17 Boys/Girls Pinan sono no Pinan sono go, Yantsu, Tsukino kata, Gekisai dai, Gekisai sho

In case of a tie, the athletes perform any KATA of their category, except for the one already performed

Kumite categories:
Age Gender Weight categories Regulations
U7 Young men -20 -25 -30 -35 +40 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.5 kg., 1 min.
U9 Young men -25 -30 -35 -40 +45 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 2.5 kg., 1 min.
U9 Girls -25 -30 -35 +35 1 min., 1 min., 2.5 kg., 1 min.
U11 Young men -30 -35 -40 -45 +50 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 3 kg., 1 min.
U11 Girls -30 -35 +40 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 3 kg., 1 min.
U13 Young men -35 -40 -45 -50 +55 2 min., 2 min., 3 kg., 1 min.
U13 Girls -35 -40 +45 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 3 kg., 1 min.
U15 Young men -50 -55 -60 -65 +65 2 min., 2 min., 3 kg., 1 min.
U15 Girls -45 -50 +50 2 min., 2 min., 3 kg., 1 min.
U17 Young men -55 -60 -65 -70 +70 2 min., 2 min., 3 kg., 1 min.
U17 Girls -50 -55 +55 2 min., 2 min., 3 kg., 1 min.

Competition conditions

Competitions are held in accordance with the "Kyokushinkai Karate Competition Rules" in force in Ukraine

Financing

Expenses for organizing competitions (awarding winners and prize-winners, renting sports equipment buildings and auxiliary premises, competition headquarters and office equipment, rent of tatami mats, payment stationery, medicines, medical and service personnel, printing posters and others paraphernalia for competitions, preparation of competition venues, placement of advertisements, transport and other expenses on the organization of competitions) are carried out at the expense of the department of culture, youth and sports Gostomel settlement council

Participant's contribution in one section - UAH 800
Participant's contribution in two sections (kumite + kata) - UAH 1,000

Awards

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded diplomas of the respective degrees, medals and cups

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until March 31, 2024. or by e-mail:
Tatarchenkoiu@ukr.net
Ihor Tatarchenko tel. +38(067)-788-77-28

Application letter for participation in the established form, other necessary documents and insurance poles are submitted to the mandate commission during the medical commission and weighing of the participants. Teams that have confirmed their participation within the set deadline are admitted to the competition
